original_title: Sri Lanka to exempt electricity, kerosene and naptha from VAT
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka is likely to maintain the exempt status from value added tax for electricity, kerosene and naptha, Treasury Secretary Mahinda Siriwardena said.
“There the policy would be to remove the exceptions; except electricity, kerosens and naptha,” he told an economic forum organized by the Ceylon Chamber of Commerce.
There are a number of taxes on petrol and diesel including excise tax, and border taxes.
“We are considering removing, or reducing, PAL [port and airport levy].”
Sri Lanka is removing most exemptions of value added tax as part of efforts to increase taxes from the people to maintain the state. (Colombo/Nov30/2023)
